page.title: 05Glass works in St. Helens
page.content: {Pilkingtons}is one of the worlds leading glassmakers. It has grown from a small family business founded in {1826}in St.Helens into a worldwide enterprize with more than{45,000} employees and subsidiary and asociated companies in{26 countries.}The group also has large interests in saftey glass, glass fibre, pressed glass and optical glass. At{Cowley Hill works} flat glass is made using the float glass process. Float glass is formed on a bath of molten tin. Float glass is made 20mm.-25mm. thick.Float glass is made into car windscreens, double glazing, solar control windows, decorative partitions, toughened doors and 'Bomolit' proof windows.All the worlds major flat glass producers use the float process under license from Pilkingtons.
